properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A storm centered south of the Labrador this morning will reach the Labrador Sea on Friday. Behind the system, strong to high winds will cause blowing snow significantly reducing visibilities until this evening or overnight tonight. ### Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-05T02:42:28-00:00

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: ROAD DUST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR SMITHERS The Ministry of Environment and Climate Change Strategy in collaboration with Northern Health has continued a Road Dust Advisory for Smithers because of high concentrations of coarse particulate matter that are expected to persist until there is precipitation or dust suppression. Levels tend to be highest around busy roads and industrial operations. This advisory is in effect until further notice. Persons with chronic underlying medical conditions should postpone strenuous exercise near busy roads until the advisory is lifted. Exposure is particularly a concern for infants, the elderly and those who have diabetes, and lung or heart disease. Real-time air quality observations and information regarding the health effects of air pollution can be found at https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. ### Children, including teenagers, are at higher risk from outdoor air pollution because they often spend time being active outdoors. Young people are more likely to have asthma and their lungs are still developing. For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-04-04T20:28:27-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2019-04-04T12:29:27-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3222585598.2019
Area: Bulkley Valley and The Lakes - northwest including Smithers
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: DUST ADVISORY AND AIR QUALITY ADVISORY ISSUED FOR PRINCE GEORGE The Ministry of Environment and Climate Change Strategy in collaboration with Northern Health has issued a Dust Advisory and an Air Quality Advisory for Prince George due to high concentrations of particulate matter (PM 2.5). This advisory remains in effect until further notice. Exposure to PM 2.5 is particularily a concern for infants, the elderly and those who have diabetes, and lung or heart disease. Persons with chronic underlying medical conditions should postpone strenuous exercise near busy roads until the advisory is lifted. If you are experiencing symptoms such as continuing eye or throat irritation, chest discomfort, shortness of breath, cough or wheezing, follow the advice of your health care provider. The City of Prince George’s Clean Air Bylaw prohibits all open burning, including backyard burning, and land clearing burning. During air quality advisories, this bylaw also prohibits street sweeping activties (unless approved by an Authorized Person), recreational fires, and use of wood-burning appliances (except for sole wood burning heat users). Industry is asked to reduce emissions wherever possible during the advisory. Real-time air quality observations and information regarding the health effects of air pollution can be found at www.bcairquality.ca. ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-04-04T20:28:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2019-04-04T12:29:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3232841758.2019
Area: Prince George
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: DUST ADVISORY ISSUED FOR VERNON The Ministry of Environment and Climate Change Strategy, in collaboration with the Interior Health Authority, has issued a Dust Advisory for Vernon due to high concentrations of coarse particulates which are expected to persist until there is a change in current weather conditions. Persons with chronic underlying medical conditions should postpone strenuous exercise until the advisory is lifted. Staying indoors and in air-conditioned spaces helps to reduce particulate exposure. Exposure is particularly a concern for infants, the elderly and those who have diabetes, and lung or heart disease. ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.

properties.Summary:

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain likely Friday morning. Precipitation moving into Southern Ontario early Friday morning is likely to fall as freezing rain as temperatures are expected to be below freezing to start the day. The freezing rain could last for several hours before temperatures rise above the freezing mark. Ice build-up is likely on elevated surfaces. Untreated surfaces such as roads, walkways and parking lots may also become icy. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-04T19:02:10-00:00

properties.Title: Snow Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Variable conditions in snow squalls. Flurries in strong onshore west to southwesterly winds will continue today with occasional snow squalls. The squalls will become more intense as temperatures fall in conjunction with the gusty winds, resulting in intermittent blizzard-like conditions with poor visibilities in blowing snow. As is generally the case with snow squalls, accumulations are likely to vary considerably, with total amounts of anywhere between 10 and 30 cm possible by Friday afternoon. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-04-05T05:16:26-00:00

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 15 cm is expected. A clash of Pacific moisture and an Arctic cold front over the Cassiar Mountains will continue to bring snow to the region today with locally heavy amounts. General accumulations totals of 5 to 10 cm will fall by midday today. Along Highway 37 between Jade City and the north end of Dease Lake, travellers can expect snowfall totals up to 15 cm of snow by midday today. The snow will ease this afternoon. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-05T00:24:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-04T12:31:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3709665221.2019
Area: Cassiar Mountains
properties.Author: Environment Canada

Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Persistent snow squalls are expected to develop. Under the snow squall bands, visibilities will be significantly reduced due to the heavy snow, and snow will quickly accumulate. Flurries and local snow squalls are expected to develop later today and persist tonight. Very strong winds and falling temperatures will combine with fresh snowfall, potentially causing localized blizzard-like conditions at times. Should the snow squalls become more frequent or widespread, warnings may be required. ### Travel may be hazardous due to sudden changes in the weather. Snow squall watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the formation of bands of snow that could produce intense accumulating snow or near zero visibilities. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-04-05T05:17:21-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-04T13:18:21-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3505006432.2019
Area: Burin Peninsula, Connaigre, Green Bay - White Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Accumulating snowfall will return again this afternoon before tapering to flurries tonight. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Snow at times heavy is expected to persist through tonight in the Hopedale and Nain forecast regions. In the Makkovik area, snow will taper to scattered flurries this afternoon before redeveloping tonight. Snow for all regions will taper to flurries through the day on Friday. Further amounts of 15 to 25 cm are expected by Friday afternoon. Strong northeasterly winds gusting to 80 km/h will spread northwards up the coast today. These gusty winds, combined with the heavy snow, will result in reduced visibilities in blowing snow. Conditions will improve tonight as winds ease somewhat. However, strong northwesterly winds with gusts to 80 km/h will redevelop early in the day on Friday, reducing visibilities in blowing snow once again. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-04-05T05:47:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-04T13:48:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3583850812.2019
Area: Postville - Makkovik, Hopedale and vicinity, Nain and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. A storm centered south of the Labrador this morning will reach the Labrador Sea on Friday. Northwest winds will strengthen today with gusts up to 90 km/h tonight. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-05T00:46:30-00:00

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strong southwesterly winds gusting to 100 km/h will develop near noon and then ease below warning criteria this evening. Strong westerly winds gusting to 100 km/h can be expected in the Canada Bay area on Friday. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
